158603774.displaySource: Random Perks: This item cannot be reacquired from Collections.

displayProperties.description: Obtain an additional random Solstice bounty.
displayProperties.name: Additional Bounties

displayProperties.description:
Meditating at the statue has infused your new armor with the Light… but its connection to the Traveler could be made stronger.

Return to Eva.
displayProperties.name: Reforged in the Light

setData.questLineDescription:
The Solstice of Heroes is a holiday in which Guardians reflect on past battles and celebrate their many efforts to defend humanity. Eva Levante has returned to help usher in the festivities.

Speak to Eva Levante in the Tower.

displayProperties.description:
Ghost receives coordinates to a literal floating island somewhere off the coast of the Winding Cove in the European Dead Zone. It's been cheekily dubbed "The European Aerial Zone," and apparently it's an excellent place to perform combat drills and meditate.

Investigate the European Aerial Zone.
displayProperties.name: Trial in the Clouds

253003204.displaySource: "There's got to be a joke here. How many Warlocks does it take to make an island float?" —Ghost

setData.questLineDescription:
The Solstice of Heroes is a holiday in which Guardians reflect on past battles and celebrate their many efforts to defend humanity. Eva Levante has returned to help usher in the festivities.

Speak to Eva Levante in the Tower.

displayProperties.description:
The Solstice of Heroes is a holiday in which Guardians reflect on past battles and celebrate their many efforts to defend humanity. Eva Levante has returned to help usher in the festivities.

Speak to Eva Levante in the Tower.
displayProperties.name: The Holiday Begins

253003205.displaySource: "I'm hearing a lot of comms chatter about some kind of floating island in the European Dead Zone. Wonder if it has anything to do with the Solstice." —Ghost

setData.questLineDescription:
The Solstice of Heroes is a holiday in which Guardians reflect on past battles and celebrate their many efforts to defend humanity. Eva Levante has returned to help usher in the festivities.

Speak to Eva Levante in the Tower.

displayProperties.description: Eva suggests you meditate on the meaning of the Solstice and the nature of renewal at the Statue of Heroes in the Tower Courtyard.
displayProperties.name: Breathe In, Breathe Out

253003206.displaySource: "The Red War feels like yesterday, sometimes. I wonder whose armor this was." —Ghost

setData.questLineDescription:
The Solstice of Heroes is a holiday in which Guardians reflect on past battles and celebrate their many efforts to defend humanity. Eva Levante has returned to help usher in the festivities.

Speak to Eva Levante in the Tower.

displayProperties.description:
As you finish your exploration of the Aerial Zone, Ghost receives a message from Eva herself. She'd like to speak to you at your earliest convenience.

Visit Eva Levante in the Tower.
displayProperties.name: But Wait, There's More!

253003207.displaySource: "She sounds really excited. I think it's nice that she gets so excited…" —Ghost

setData.questLineDescription:

351381400.displaySource: "Ikora's looking for some Solar Guardians to deal with the Cabal in the EDZ. They've taken a lot from us, but don't let that cloud your judgment. Come back safe." —Eva Levante

displayProperties.name: A Nova One Bites the Dust

599433014.displaySource: "Ikora said she needed a Void Guardian to handle a 'Hive problem.' Does that make you all the best at sword logic? No one's been able to explain sword logic to me in a way that's satisfying. For example, Shaxx fears me, but not because I'm stronger than him. How does sword logic account for that?" —Eva Levante

795843925.displaySource: Wise and sly and perfect, your instructions drop, leaving nothing but the hard sweet rime of enlightenment.

displayProperties.name: Nadir to Apex (Part II)

795843926.displaySource: Your voice moves as a whisper, murmuring inside larger winds. Only the trusted few can absorb what is necessary.

displayProperties.name: Nadir to Apex (Part I)

795843927.displaySource:
The best voices–––voices that truly matter–––never allow themselves be heard. This lesson is worth learning again and again.

Forever.
